result.execSummary:
The defendant Bradley J. Cron was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety with the exception of prescription medications.

Submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.
Maintain full-time employment, schooling or a combination of both.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bradley J. Cron

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on August 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.

11:02 am   Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed. Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea(s) entered.  Jury calendar.
Offer deadline:  5/13/22, 8:30 a.m.
Minutes.
Further proceedings scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

This warrant should have never gone out.  It was ordered, but the matter was rescheduled and that information was not relayed to Clerk's office so warrant was not canceled.  This was discovered today, after defendant was arrested on the warrant and taken into custody.  Once the error was discovered, the defendant was released from custody.  (see note on notice of hearing)

1:36 pm - Prosecuting attorney Angelina R Scarpelli in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Bradley J. Cron in court.  Attorney James Gregory McCann appeared by video for Bradley J. Cron. Defendant demands a preliminary hearing. Preliminary hearing is set for 04-07-22 at 10:30 a.m.
Preliminary hearing on April 7, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Initial appearance on March 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Defendant failed to appear for initial appearance.   Bench warrant authorized.   
Minutes.

ADDRESS INFO for Bradley J. Cron
Current: 4213 Mishicot Road, Mishicot, WI 54228 United States  (Effective: 02-17-2022)
Prior: 1000 19Th St, Two Rivers, WI 54241

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of possess THC - 2nd offense, possess cocaine and possess drug paraphernalia.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 02-28-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 2.  Bail is set at $5,000.00 recognizance bond with the condition that he maintain absolute sobriety from controlled substances.   Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody. 
Minutes.
